meanings.definition: Educated or trained in a particular skill or subject.
meanings.sent1: The young artist was schooled in painting techniques by her grandmother.
meanings.sent2: She is a schooled musician, having learned to play the piano at a young age.
meanings.sent3: The clever parrot schooled the other birds in mimicking human speech.
meanings.sent4: His experience as a chef schooled him in the art of creating delicious dishes.
meanings.sent5: The wise old owl schooled the young owlets in the ways of the forest.

meanings.definition: Taught or instructed in a formal setting.
meanings.sent1: The students were schooled in mathematics by their dedicated teacher.
meanings.sent2: She is a schooled dancer, having trained at a prestigious ballet academy.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten schooled the puppies in how to climb trees.
meanings.sent4: His time at the military academy schooled him in discipline and leadership.
meanings.sent5: The experienced coach schooled the new players in the team's strategies.

meanings.definition: Defeated or outperformed in a competition or argument.
meanings.sent1: The chess champion schooled his opponent in a quick and decisive match.
meanings.sent2: She felt schooled by her opponent's well-prepared arguments during the debate.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox schooled the other animals in the forest in a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: His older brother always schooled him in basketball, never letting him win.
meanings.sent5: The experienced debater schooled the newcomers with her persuasive speaking skills.
